articles.author: David Chang
articles.title: Gunman Shoots 2 Women, Man in Cheltenham Walmart, Crashes Into Police Vehicle, Officials Say
articles.description: Three customers were shot and two officers were injured after a gunman opened fire inside a Cheltenham Township, Pennsylvania, Walmart store and then crashed into a police vehicle while fleeing the scene...

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews
articles.title: Illinois sues Trump Tower over Chicago River water use
articles.description: The state's lawsuit claims the hotel uses millions of gallons of river water "without a permit".

articles.author: Matt Richardson
articles.title: Woman arrested at 'extremist Muslim' New Mexico compound moved to federal custody, sheriff says
articles.description: Jany Leveille, one of the five suspects arrested at the "extremist Muslim" compound in northern New Mexico, has been transferred to the custody of U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS), Taos County Sheriff Jerry Hogrefe said Tuesday.

articles.title: A football player died, and all of the University of Maryland is diminished
articles.description: The school’s handling of the tragedy, from the time 19-year-old Jordan McNair suffered heatstroke at a practice in May to Tuesday’s news conference by university leaders to apologize for his death, has diminished the entire institution in College Park.

articles.author: Blair Miller
articles.title: Natural gas explosion, building collapse injures 9 on Santa Fe Drive in Denver
articles.description: A natural gas explosion caused at least one residential building to partially collapse Tuesday on Santa Fe Drive near 4th Ave. in Denver, injuring at least seven people.

articles.author: Debora Patta
articles.title: Barriers set up after Westminster car ramming may have saved lives in London attack
articles.description: Three people were treated after a car hit a group of cyclists and jumped a sidewalk

articles.author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Christina Tkacik
articles.title: Baltimore police officer charged with assault after video shows him beating man
articles.description: A Baltimore Police officer has been charged with assault and misconduct in office following an incident Saturday in which he was captured on video repeatedly punching a man.

articles.author: Alison Bowen
articles.title: 'They are a very, very precious commodity': Chicago surgeon shares experience with face transplant
articles.description: A Chicago plastic surgeon who was on a team that performed a face transplant explains the process.

articles.author: Joshua Hoyos
articles.title: Nearly 1 year after Hurricane Maria, 100 percent of customers have power in Puerto Rico: Officials
articles.description: Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority said Tuesday that today represents the end of the restoration of power to customers that are able to get power.

articles.title: 4 states vote in key primary elections
articles.description: Voters head to the polls to cast their ballots in four states: Connecticut, Minnesota, Vermont and Wisconsin. Follow here for the latest.

articles.title: Catholic Church Covered Up Child Sex Abuse in Pennsylvania for Decades, Grand Jury Says
articles.description: The grand jury report is the government’s broadest look yet in the United States at child sexual abuse in the church.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/aohlheiser
articles.title: Trump's opponents can't stop retweeting @NotPeterStrzok, an obvious Peter Strzok parody account
articles.description: A tweet from a parody account of the fired FBI agent went more viral than anything the real Peter Strzok has tweeted.

articles.title: Florida's Gulf Coast Battles Deadly And Smelly Red Tide
articles.description: A toxic algae bloom is killing fish, turtles and dolphins and discouraging tourists from visiting Florida's Gulf Coast. It's not the first such event, but it is especially intense.

articles.author: http://nytimes.com/by/erica-l-green
articles.title: Kavanaugh Could Unlock Funding for Religious Education, School Voucher Advocates Say
articles.description: Brett M. Kavanaugh’s confirmation to the Supreme Court could advance efforts to make publicly funded vouchers available to students attending religious schools.

articles.author: Steve Gorman
articles.title: Yosemite reopens its valley, as flames and smoke linger
articles.description: The heart of Yosemite National Park in California, shut down for nearly three weeks due to a deadly wildfire, was reopened to visitors on Tuesday, but smoke limited visibility and a key route to the park's best known landmarks remained closed.

articles.author: Barbara Starr, CNN Pentagon Correspondent
articles.title: Exclusive: Pentagon spokeswoman under investigation for misusing staff, retaliating against complaints
articles.description: One of Defense Secretary James Mattis' most senior civilian advisers is being investigated by the Defense Department Office of Inspector General for allegedly retaliating against staff members after she used some of them to conduct her personal errands and bu…

articles.author: Lauren McGaughy
articles.title: Classes canceled after adults threaten 'open hunting seasons' on 12-year-old transgender Oklahoman
articles.description: An Oklahoma school district just north of the Texas border has canceled classes this week after a transgender student used a shared bathroom at her...

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/sharon-lafraniere
articles.title: Manafort Lawyers Rest Without Calling Witnesses in Fraud Trial
articles.description: Defense lawyers did not present any witnesses in Paul Manafort’s trial, while prosecutors called roughly two dozen.

articles.title: 'My dad taught us some moves': Girls used kicks and coffee to escape a kidnapper, police say
articles.description: Bruce Hipkins was arrested on numerous charges, including kidnapping, police said.

articles.title: Outdoor urinals in Paris have residents aghast
articles.description: Open-air urinals have appeared in the heart of Paris in a council experiment that is appalling residents and surprising tourists. After a trial that began near the Gare de Lyon and the Moulin Rouge...
